00199   printf( "------- TOTAL SPACE USED FOR WORKER THREAD: %12lu (on %2u pages)\n",
00200       (unsigned long)bstats.StdUsedSpace, bstats.NbStdUsed );
00201 
00202   /* DisplayMemoryMap(); */

00204   printf( "--------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
00205

00242       
00250 int nfs_Init_svc( )
00251 {
00252 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00253   struct netconfig      * netconfig_udpv4 ;
00254   struct netconfig      * netconfig_tcpv4 ;
00255 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00256   struct netconfig      * netconfig_udpv6 ;
00257   struct netconfig      * netconfig_tcpv6 ;
00258 #endif
00259 #endif
00260   struct sockaddr_in      sinaddr_nfs;
00261   struct sockaddr_in      sinaddr_mnt;
00262 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00263   struct sockaddr_in6     sinaddr_nfs_udp6 ;
00264   struct sockaddr_in6     sinaddr_mnt_udp6 ;
00265   struct netbuf           netbuf_nfs_udp6 ;
00266   struct netbuf           netbuf_mnt_udp6 ;
00267   struct sockaddr_in6     sinaddr_nfs_tcp6 ;
00268   struct sockaddr_in6     sinaddr_mnt_tcp6 ;
00269   struct netbuf           netbuf_nfs_tcp6 ;
00270   struct netbuf           netbuf_mnt_tcp6 ;
00271   struct t_bind           bindaddr_nfs_udp6 ;
00272   struct t_bind           bindaddr_mnt_udp6 ;
00273   struct t_bind           bindaddr_nfs_tcp6 ;
00274   struct t_bind           bindaddr_mnt_tcp6 ;
00275   struct __rpc_sockinfo   si_nfs_tcp6;
00276   struct __rpc_sockinfo   si_nfs_udp6;
00277   struct __rpc_sockinfo   si_mnt_tcp6;
00278   struct __rpc_sockinfo   si_mnt_udp6;
00279 #endif
00280   int                     one = 1 ;
00281   int                     rc = 0 ;
00282   int                     nb_svc_nfs_ok = 0 ;
00283   int                     nb_svc_mnt_ok = 0 ;
00284 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00285   OM_uint32               maj_stat ;
00286   OM_uint32               min_stat ;
00287   char                    GssError[1024] ;
00288   gss_cred_id_t           test_gss_cred = NULL ;
00289   gss_name_t              imported_name  = NULL ;
00290 #endif
00291 
00292   FD_ZERO( &Svc_fdset ) ;
00293 
00294 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00295    DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: Using TIRPC" ) ;
00296 #endif
00297 
00298 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00299    DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: Using IPv6" ) ; 
00300 #endif 
00301 
00302 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00303   /* Get the netconfig entries from /etc/netconfig */
00304   if( ( netconfig_udpv4 = (struct netconfig *)getnetconfigent( "udp" ) ) == NULL )
00305     {
00306       DisplayLog( "/!\\ Cannot get a entry for udp in netconfig file. Check file /etc/netconfig..." ) ;
00307       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get udp netconfig" ) ;
00308       return -1 ;
00309     }
00310 
00311   /* Get the netconfig entries from /etc/netconfig */
00312   if( ( netconfig_tcpv4 = (struct netconfig *)getnetconfigent( "tcp" ) ) == NULL )
00313     {
00314       DisplayLog( "/!\\ Cannot get a entry for tcp in netconfig file. Check file /etc/netconfig..." ) ;
00315       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get tcp netconfig" ) ;
00316       return -1 ;
00317     }
00318 
00319 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00320   /* Get the netconfig entries from /etc/netconfig */
00321   if( ( netconfig_udpv6 = (struct netconfig *)getnetconfigent( "udp6" ) ) == NULL )
00322     {
00323       DisplayLog( "/!\\ Cannot get a entry for udp6 in netconfig file. Check file /etc/netconfig..." ) ;
00324       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get udp6 netconfig" ) ;
00325       return -1 ;
00326     }
00327 
00328   /* Get the netconfig entries from /etc/netconfig */
00329   if( ( netconfig_tcpv6 = (struct netconfig *)getnetconfigent( "tcp6" ) ) == NULL )
00330     {
00331       DisplayLog( "/!\\ Cannot get a entry for tcp in netconfig file. Check file /etc/netconfig..." ) ;
00332       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get tcp6 netconfig" ) ;
00333       return -1 ;
00334     }
00335 
00336 #endif
00337 
00338  /* A short message to show that /etc/netconfig parsing was a success */ 
00339  DisplayLog( "netconfig found for UDPv4 and TCPv4" ) ;
00340 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00341  DisplayLog( "netconfig found for UDPv6 and TCPv6" ) ;
00342 #endif
00343 
00344   /* RW_lock need to be inited */
00345   rw_lock_init( &Svc_lock ) ;
00346   rw_lock_init( &Svc_fd_lock ) ;
00347 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC */
00348 
00349 #ifndef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00350   /* Allocate the UDP and TCP structure for the RPC */
00351   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00352     {
00353       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00354       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp socket" ) ;
00355       return -1 ;
00356     }
00357   
00358   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00359     {
00360       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00361       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp socket" ) ;
00362       return -1 ;
00363     }
00364 
00365   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00366     {
00367       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00368       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp socket" ) ;
00369       return -1 ;
00370     }
00371   
00372   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00373     {
00374       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00375       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp socket" ) ;
00376       return -1 ;
00377     }
00378 
00379 #else
00380  /* Allocate the UDP and TCP structure for the RPC */
00381   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp = socket( AF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00382     {
00383       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00384       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp6 socket" ) ;
00385       return -1 ;
00386     }
00387   
00388   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp = socket( AF_INET6, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00389     {
00390       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00391       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp6 socket" ) ;
00392       return -1 ;
00393 
00394     }
00395 
00396   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp = socket( AF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP ) ) < 0 )
00397     {
00398       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00399       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a udp6 socket" ) ;
00400       return -1 ;
00401     }
00402   
00403   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp = socket( AF_INET6, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP) ) < 0 )
00404     {
00405       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SOCKET, errno ) ;
00406       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate a tcp6 socket" ) ;
00407       return -1 ;
00408     }
00409 
00410 #endif
00411 
00412 
00413   /* Use SO_REUSEADDR in order to avoid wait the 2MSL timeout */
00414   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
00415                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00416     {
00417       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00418       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad udp socket options" ) ;
00419       return -1 ;
00420     }
00421 
00422   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp,
00423                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00424     {
00425       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00426       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad tcp socket options" ) ;
00427       return -1 ;
00428     }
00429 
00430   socket_setoptions( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp  ) ;
00431   
00432   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00433                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00434     {
00435       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00436       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad udp socket options" ) ;
00437       return -1 ;
00438     }
00439   
00440   if( setsockopt( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp,
00441                   SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof( one ) ) )
00442     {
00443       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSOCKOPT, errno ) ;
00444       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Bad tcp socket options" ) ;
00445       return -1 ;
00446     }
00447   
00448   /* We prefer using non-blocking socket in the specific case */
00449   if( fcntl( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, F_SETFL, FNDELAY) == -1) 
00450     {
00451       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_FCNTL, errno ) ;
00452       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot set udp socket as non blocking" ) ;
00453       return -1 ;
00454     }
00455 
00456   if( fcntl( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, F_SETFL, FNDELAY) == -1) 
00457     {
00458       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_FCNTL, errno ) ;
00459       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot set udp socket as non blocking" ) ;
00460       return -1 ;
00461     }
00462 
00463   /* Some log that can be useful when debug ONC/RPC and RPCSEC_GSS matter */ 
00464   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Socket numbers are: nfs_udp=%u  nfs_tcp=%u  mnt_udp=%u  mnt_tcp=%u", 
00465                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, 
00466                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp,
00467                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00468                    nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp ) ; 
00469   
00470   /* Bind the udp and tcp socket to port 2049/tcp and 2049/udp */
00471   memset((char *) &sinaddr_nfs, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) );
00472   sinaddr_nfs.sin_family      = AF_INET ;
00473   sinaddr_nfs.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00474   sinaddr_nfs.sin_port        = htons( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_port );
00475 
00476 
00477   /* It's now time for binding the sockets */
00478 #ifndef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00479   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, 
00480             (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_nfs, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) ) == -1)
00481     {
00482       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00483       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp socket" ) ;
00484       return -1 ;
00485     }
00486 
00487   if( ( rc = bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00488                    (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_nfs, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs ) ) ) == -1)
00489     {
00490       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00491       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00492       return -1 ;
00493     }
00494 
00495   /* Bind the udp and tcp socket to ephemeral port for mountd */
00496   memset((char *) &sinaddr_mnt, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) );
00497   sinaddr_mnt.sin_family      = AF_INET ;
00498   sinaddr_mnt.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00499   sinaddr_mnt.sin_port        = htons( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_port ) ;
00500 
00501   /* It's now time for binding the sockets */
00502   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, 
00503             (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_mnt, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) ) == -1)
00504     {
00505       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00506       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp socket" ) ;
00507       return -1 ;
00508     }
00509 
00510   if( ( rc = bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00511                    (struct sockaddr *) &sinaddr_mnt, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt ) ) ) == -1)
00512     {
00513       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00514       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00515       return -1 ;
00516     }
00517 
00518 #else
00519   /* Bind the udp and tcp socket to port 2049/tcp and 2049/udp */
00520   memset((char *) &sinaddr_nfs_udp6, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_udp6 ) );
00521   sinaddr_nfs_udp6.sin6_family = AF_INET6 ;
00522   sinaddr_nfs_udp6.sin6_addr   = in6addr_any ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00523   sinaddr_nfs_udp6.sin6_port   = htons( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_port );
00524 
00525   netbuf_nfs_udp6.maxlen = sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_udp6 ) ;
00526   netbuf_nfs_udp6.len    = sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_udp6 ) ;
00527   netbuf_nfs_udp6.buf    = &sinaddr_nfs_udp6 ;
00528 
00529   bindaddr_nfs_udp6.qlen = SOMAXCONN ;
00530   bindaddr_nfs_udp6.addr = netbuf_nfs_udp6 ;
00531 
00532   if(!__rpc_fd2sockinfo( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, &si_nfs_udp6) )
00533    {
00534       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get socket info for udp6 socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00535       return -1 ;
00536    }
00537 
00538   memset((char *) &sinaddr_nfs_tcp6, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_tcp6 ) );
00539   sinaddr_nfs_tcp6.sin6_family = AF_INET6 ;
00540   sinaddr_nfs_tcp6.sin6_addr   = in6addr_any ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00541   sinaddr_nfs_tcp6.sin6_port   = htons( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_port );
00542 
00543   netbuf_nfs_tcp6.maxlen = sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_tcp6 ) ;
00544   netbuf_nfs_tcp6.len    = sizeof( sinaddr_nfs_tcp6 ) ;
00545   netbuf_nfs_tcp6.buf    = &sinaddr_nfs_tcp6 ;
00546 
00547   bindaddr_nfs_tcp6.qlen = SOMAXCONN ;
00548   bindaddr_nfs_tcp6.addr = netbuf_nfs_tcp6 ;
00549 
00550  if(!__rpc_fd2sockinfo( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, &si_nfs_tcp6) )
00551    {
00552       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get socket info for tcp6 socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00553       return -1 ;
00554    }
00555 
00556   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00557             (struct sockaddr *)bindaddr_nfs_tcp6.addr.buf, 
00558             (socklen_t)si_nfs_tcp6.si_alen ) == -1)
00559     {
00560       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00561       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp6 socket" ) ;
00562       return -1 ;
00563     }
00564 
00565   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp, 
00566             (struct sockaddr *)bindaddr_nfs_udp6.addr.buf, 
00567             (socklen_t)si_nfs_udp6.si_alen ) == -1)
00568     {
00569       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00570       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp6 socket" ) ;
00571       return -1 ;
00572     }
00573 
00574   memset((char *) &sinaddr_mnt_udp6, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_udp6 ) );
00575   sinaddr_mnt_udp6.sin6_family = AF_INET6 ;
00576   sinaddr_mnt_udp6.sin6_addr   = in6addr_any ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00577   sinaddr_mnt_udp6.sin6_port   = htons( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_port );
00578 
00579   netbuf_mnt_udp6.maxlen = sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_udp6 ) ;
00580   netbuf_mnt_udp6.len    = sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_udp6 ) ;
00581   netbuf_mnt_udp6.buf    = &sinaddr_mnt_udp6 ;
00582 
00583   bindaddr_mnt_udp6.qlen = SOMAXCONN ;
00584   bindaddr_mnt_udp6.addr = netbuf_mnt_udp6 ;
00585 
00586   if(!__rpc_fd2sockinfo( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, &si_mnt_udp6) )
00587    {
00588       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get socket info for udp6 socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00589       return -1 ;
00590    }
00591 
00592   memset((char *) &sinaddr_mnt_tcp6, 0, sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_tcp6 ) );
00593   sinaddr_mnt_tcp6.sin6_family = AF_INET6 ;
00594   sinaddr_mnt_tcp6.sin6_addr   = in6addr_any ; /* All the interfaces on the machine are used */
00595   sinaddr_mnt_tcp6.sin6_port   = htons( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_port );
00596 
00597   netbuf_mnt_tcp6.maxlen = sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_tcp6 ) ;
00598   netbuf_mnt_tcp6.len    = sizeof( sinaddr_mnt_tcp6 ) ;
00599   netbuf_mnt_tcp6.buf    = &sinaddr_mnt_tcp6 ;
00600 
00601   bindaddr_mnt_tcp6.qlen = SOMAXCONN ;
00602   bindaddr_mnt_tcp6.addr = netbuf_mnt_tcp6 ;
00603 
00604   if(!__rpc_fd2sockinfo( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, &si_mnt_tcp6) )
00605    {
00606       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot get socket info for udp6 socket rc=%d errno=%d", rc, errno ) ;
00607       return -1 ;
00608    }
00609 
00610  if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00611             (struct sockaddr *)bindaddr_mnt_tcp6.addr.buf, 
00612             (socklen_t)si_mnt_tcp6.si_alen ) == -1)
00613     {
00614       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00615       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind tcp6 socket" ) ;
00616       return -1 ;
00617     }
00618 
00619   if( bind( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp, 
00620             (struct sockaddr *)bindaddr_mnt_tcp6.addr.buf, 
00621             (socklen_t)si_mnt_udp6.si_alen ) == -1)
00622     {
00623       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_BIND, errno ) ;
00624 
00625       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot bind udp6 socket" ) ;
00626       return -1 ;
00627     }
00628 
00629 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00630 
00631 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00632   /* Unset the former registration to the rpcbind daemon */
00633   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2, netconfig_udpv4 ) ;
00634   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3, netconfig_udpv4 ) ;
00635   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4, netconfig_udpv4 ) ;
00636 
00637   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1, netconfig_udpv4 ) ;
00638   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3, netconfig_udpv4 ) ;
00639 
00640   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2, netconfig_tcpv4 ) ;
00641   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3, netconfig_tcpv4 ) ;
00642   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4, netconfig_tcpv4 ) ;
00643 
00644   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1, netconfig_tcpv4 ) ;
00645   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3, netconfig_tcpv4 ) ;
00646 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00647   /* Unset rpcbind registration for IPv6 related protocols */
00648   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2, netconfig_udpv6 ) ;
00649   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3, netconfig_udpv6 ) ;
00650   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4, netconfig_udpv6 ) ;
00651 
00652   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1, netconfig_udpv6 ) ;
00653   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3, netconfig_udpv6 ) ;
00654 
00655   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2, netconfig_tcpv6 ) ;
00656   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3, netconfig_tcpv6 ) ;
00657   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4, netconfig_tcpv6 ) ;
00658 
00659   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1, netconfig_tcpv6 ) ;
00660   rpcb_unset(  nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3, netconfig_tcpv6 ) ;
00661 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00662 #else  
00663   /* Unset the port mapper */
00664   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V2 );
00665   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V3 );
00666   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program, NFS_V4 );
00667 
00668   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V1 );
00669   pmap_unset( nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program, MOUNT_V3 );
00670 #endif
00671 
00672   /* Allocation of the SVCXPRT */
00673   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Allocation of the SVCXPRT" ) ;
00674 
00675   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp = 
00676 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00677         Svc_dg_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
00678                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00679                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00680 #else
00681         Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
00682                           NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00683                           NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00684 #endif
00685     {
00686       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00687       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate NFS/UDP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00688       return -1  ;
00689     }
00690 
00691 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00692   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp->xp_netid = strdup( netconfig_udpv6->nc_netid );
00693   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp->xp_tp    = strdup( netconfig_udpv6->nc_device ); 
00694 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00695 
00696 
00697   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp =
00698 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00699         Svc_vc_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00700                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00701                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00702 #else
00703         Svctcp_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, 
00704                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00705                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00706 #endif
00707     {
00708       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCTCP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00709       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate NFS/TCP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00710       return -1  ;
00711     }  
00712 
00713 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00714   if( listen( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp, (int)bindaddr_nfs_tcp6.qlen ) != 0 )
00715     {
00716       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot listen on  NFS/TCPv6 SVCXPRT, errno=%u", errno  ) ;
00717       return -1  ;
00718     }
00719 
00720   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp->xp_netid = strdup( netconfig_tcpv6->nc_netid );
00721   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp->xp_tp    = strdup( netconfig_tcpv6->nc_device ); 
00722 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00723 
00724 
00725   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp = 
00726 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00727        Svc_dg_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00728                       NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00729                       NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00730 #else
00731         Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
00732                           NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00733                           NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00734 #endif
00735     {
00736       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00737       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate MNT/UDP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00738       return -1  ;
00739     }
00740 
00741 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00742   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp->xp_netid = strdup( netconfig_udpv6->nc_netid );
00743   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp->xp_tp    = strdup( netconfig_udpv6->nc_device ); 
00744 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00745 
00746 
00747   if( ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp =
00748 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00749          Svc_vc_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00750                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00751                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00752 #else
00753         Svctcp_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, 
00754                        NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, 
00755                        NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
00756 #endif
00757     {
00758       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCTCP_CREATE, 0 ) ;
00759       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot allocate MNT/TCP SVCXPRT" ) ;
00760       return -1  ;
00761     }  
00762 
00763 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00764   if( listen( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp, (int)bindaddr_mnt_tcp6.qlen ) != 0 )
00765     {
00766       DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot listen on  MNT/TCPv6 SVCXPRT, errno=%u", errno ) ;
00767       return -1  ;
00768     }
00769 
00770   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp->xp_netid = strdup( netconfig_tcpv6->nc_netid );
00771   nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp->xp_tp    = strdup( netconfig_tcpv6->nc_device ); 
00772 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */
00773 
00774 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00775   /* Acquire RPCSEC_GSS basis if needed */
00776   if( nfs_param.krb5_param.active_krb5 == TRUE )
00777     {
00778      if( Svcauth_gss_import_name( nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) != TRUE )
00779        {
00780          DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Could not import principal name %s into GSSAPI", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00781          exit( 1 ) ;
00782        }
00783      else
00784        {
00785          DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Successfully imported principal %s into GSSAPI", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00786 
00787         
00788         /* Trying to acquire a credentials for checking name's validity */
00789         if( !Svcauth_gss_acquire_cred() )
00790            {
00791                DisplayLog( "NFS EXIT: Cannot acquire credentials for principal %s", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;
00792                exit( 1 ) ;
00793            }
00794          else
00795            {
00796                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Principal %s is suitable for acquiring credentials", nfs_param.krb5_param.principal ) ;    
00797            }
00798        }
00799     } /* if( nfs_param.krb5_param.active_krb5 == TRUE ) */
00800  
00801 #endif
00802 
00803   /* Perform all the RPC registration, for UDP and TCP, for NFS_V2, NFS_V3 and NFS_V4 */
00804   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registration to the portmapper for NFS and MOUNT, on UDP and TCP" ) ;
00805 
00806 /* only NFSv4 is supported for the FSAL_PROXY */
00807 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined ( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
00808   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/UDP" ) ;
00809 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00810    if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00811                  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00812                  NFS_V2, 
00813                  nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00814                  netconfig_udpv4 ) )
00815 #else
00816   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00817                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00818                      NFS_V2, 
00819                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00820                      IPPROTO_UDP ) )
00821 #endif
00822     {
00823       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00824       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on UDP" ) ;
00825     }
00826   else
00827       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00828  
00829 
00830   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/UDP" ) ;
00831 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00832   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp,
00833                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00834                 NFS_V3, 
00835                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00836                 netconfig_udpv4 ) ) 
00837 #else
00838   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp,
00839                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00840                      NFS_V3, 
00841                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00842                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00843 #endif
00844     {
00845       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00846       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on UDP" ) ;
00847     }
00848   else
00849       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00850 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00851   
00852   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/UDP" ) ;
00853 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00854   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00855                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00856                 NFS_V4, 
00857                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00858                 netconfig_udpv4 ) ) 
00859 #else
00860   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00861                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00862                      NFS_V4, 
00863                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00864                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
00865 #endif
00866     {
00867       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00868       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on UDP" ) ;
00869     }
00870   else
00871     {
00872       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00873 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00874       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00875 #endif
00876     }
00877 
00878 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00879   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/UDPv6" ) ;
00880   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00881                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00882                 NFS_V2, 
00883                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00884                 netconfig_udpv6 ) )
00885     {
00886       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00887       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on UDPv6" ) ;
00888     }
00889   else
00890     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00891 
00892   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/UDPv6" ) ;
00893   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00894                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00895                 NFS_V3, 
00896                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00897                 netconfig_udpv6 ) )
00898     {
00899       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00900       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on UDPv6" ) ;
00901     }
00902   else
00903     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00904 
00905 
00906   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/UDPv6" ) ;
00907   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_udp, 
00908                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00909                 NFS_V4, 
00910                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00911                 netconfig_udpv6 ) )
00912     {
00913       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00914       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on UDPv6" ) ;
00915     }
00916   else
00917     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00918 
00919 #endif 
00920  
00921 #ifndef _NO_TCP_REGISTER
00922   
00923 /* only NFSv4 is supported for the FSAL_PROXY */
00924 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined ( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
00925     
00926   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/TCP" ) ;
00927 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00928   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00929                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00930                 NFS_V2, 
00931                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00932                 netconfig_tcpv4 ) ) 
00933 #else
00934   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00935                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00936                      NFS_V2, 
00937                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00938                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00939 #endif
00940     {
00941       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00942       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on TCP" ) ;
00943     }
00944   else
00945       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00946 
00947   
00948   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/TCP" ) ;
00949 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00950  if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00951                nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00952                NFS_V3, 
00953                nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00954                netconfig_tcpv4 ) ) 
00955 #else
00956   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00957                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00958                      NFS_V3, 
00959                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00960                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00961 #endif
00962     {
00963       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00964       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on TCP" ) ;
00965     }
00966   else
00967       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00968 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
00969   
00970   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/TCP" ) ;
00971 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00972   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00973                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00974                 NFS_V4, 
00975                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00976                 netconfig_tcpv4 ) ) 
00977 #else
00978   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00979                      nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00980                      NFS_V4, 
00981                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
00982                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
00983 #endif
00984     {
00985       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
00986       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on TCP" ) ;
00987     }
00988   else
00989     {
00990       nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
00991 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00992       nb_svc_nfs_ok = 1 ;
00993 #endif
00994     }
00995 
00996 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
00997   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V2/TCPv6" ) ;
00998   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
00999                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
01000                 NFS_V2, 
01001                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01002                 netconfig_tcpv6 ) )
01003     {
01004       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01005       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V2 on TCPv6" ) ;
01006     }
01007   else
01008     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
01009 
01010   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V3/TCPv6" ) ;
01011   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
01012                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
01013                 NFS_V3, 
01014                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01015                 netconfig_tcpv6 ) )
01016     {
01017       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01018       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V3 on TCPv6" ) ;
01019     }
01020   else
01021     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
01022 
01023 
01024   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering NFS V4/TCPv6" ) ;
01025   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp, 
01026                 nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
01027                 NFS_V4, 
01028                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01029                 netconfig_tcpv6 ) )
01030     {
01031       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01032       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register NFS V4 on TCPv6" ) ;
01033     }
01034   else
01035     nb_svc_nfs_ok += 1 ;
01036 
01037 #endif /* _USE_TIRPC_IPV6 */ 
01038 
01039 #endif
01040    
01041 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined ( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
01042   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/UDP" ) ;
01043 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01044   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01045                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01046                 MOUNT_V1,
01047                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01048                 netconfig_udpv4 ) ) 
01049 #else
01050   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01051                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01052                      MOUNT_V1,
01053                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01054                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
01055 #endif
01056     {
01057       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01058       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on UDP" ) ;
01059     }
01060   else
01061       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01062 
01063   
01064   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/UDP" ) ;
01065 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01066   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01067                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01068                 MOUNT_V3,
01069                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01070                 netconfig_udpv4 ) ) 
01071 #else
01072   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01073                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01074                      MOUNT_V3,
01075                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01076                      IPPROTO_UDP ) ) 
01077 #endif
01078     {
01079       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01080       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on UDP" ) ;
01081     }
01082   else
01083       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01084 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
01085 
01086 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
01087   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/UDPv6" ) ;
01088   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01089                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01090                 MOUNT_V1, 
01091                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01092                 netconfig_udpv6 ) )
01093     {
01094       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01095       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on UDPv6" ) ;
01096     }
01097   else
01098     nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01099 
01100   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/UDPv6" ) ;
01101   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_udp, 
01102                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01103                 MOUNT_V3, 
01104                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01105                 netconfig_udpv6 ) )
01106     {
01107       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01108       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on UDPv6" ) ;
01109     }
01110   else
01111     nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01112 
01113 #endif
01114 
01115 
01116 #ifndef _NO_TCP_REGISTER  
01117  
01118 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined ( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
01119   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/TCP" ) ;
01120 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01121   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01122                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01123                 MOUNT_V1,
01124                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01125                 netconfig_tcpv4 ) ) 
01126 #else
01127   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01128                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01129                      MOUNT_V1,
01130                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01131                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
01132 #endif
01133     {
01134       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01135       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on TCP" ) ;
01136     }
01137   else
01138       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01139 
01140   
01141   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/TCP" ) ;
01142 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01143   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01144                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01145                 MOUNT_V3,
01146                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01147                 netconfig_tcpv4 ) ) 
01148 #else
01149   if( !Svc_register( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01150                      nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01151                      MOUNT_V3,
01152                      nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01153                      IPPROTO_TCP ) ) 
01154 #endif
01155     {
01156       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01157       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on TCP" ) ;
01158     }
01159   else
01160       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01161 #else
01162       nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01163 #endif /* _USE_PROXY */
01164 
01165 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC_IPV6
01166   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V1/TCPv6" ) ;
01167   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01168                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01169                 MOUNT_V1, 
01170                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01171                 netconfig_tcpv6 ) )
01172     {
01173       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01174       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V1 on TCPv6" ) ;
01175     }
01176   else
01177     nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01178 
01179   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Registering MOUNT V3/TCPv6" ) ;
01180   if( !svc_reg( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp, 
01181                 nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
01182                 MOUNT_V3, 
01183                 nfs_rpc_dispatch_dummy, 
01184                 netconfig_tcpv6 ) )
01185     {
01186       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVC_REGISTER, 0 ) ;
01187       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Cannot register MOUNT V3 on TCPv6" ) ;
01188     }
01189   else
01190     nb_svc_mnt_ok += 1 ;
01191 
01192 #endif
01193 
01194 
01195 #endif /* _NO_TCP_REGISTER */
01196   
01197   /* Were at least one NFS/MNT registration ok ? */
01198   if( nb_svc_nfs_ok == 0 ||nb_svc_mnt_ok == 0 )
01199      {
01200         /* Not enough registration for servicing clients */
01201         DisplayLog( "NFS_DISPATCHER: /!\\ | No registration to NFS and/or MOUNT programs were done..." ) ;
01202 
01203 #if _USE_TIRPC
01204         freenetconfigent( netconfig_udpv4 );
01205         freenetconfigent( netconfig_tcpv4 );
01206 #endif
01207         return 1 ;
01208      }
01209 
01210 #if _USE_TIRPC
01211   freenetconfigent( netconfig_udpv4 );
01212   freenetconfigent( netconfig_tcpv4 );
01213 #endif
01214  
01215   return 0 ;
01216 } /* nfs_Init_svc */
01217 
01218 
01223 static unsigned int select_worker_queue( )
01224 {
01225 #define NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN  1000000
01226   unsigned int worker_index = NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN;
01227   unsigned int min_number_pending = NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN ;
01228   
01229   unsigned int i;
01230   static unsigned int last ;
01231   unsigned int cpt = 0 ;
01232 
01233   do {
01234   
01235     /* chose the smallest queue */
01236     
01237     for( i = (last +1)% nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker , cpt = 0 ; cpt <  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ; cpt ++ , i = ( i + 1 ) %  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ) 
01238     {
01239         /* Choose only fully initialized workers and that does not gc */
01240       
01241         if ( ( workers_data[i].gc_in_progress == FALSE )
01242                    && ( workers_data[i].is_ready == TRUE ) )
01243         {
01244           if ( workers_data[i].pending_request->nb_entry < min_number_pending )
01245           {
01246             worker_index = i;
01247             min_number_pending = workers_data[i].pending_request->nb_entry;
01248           }
01249         }
01250 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01251         else if ( ! workers_data[i].is_ready )
01252           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "worker thread #%u is not ready", i ) ;
01253         else if ( workers_data[i].gc_in_progress )
01254           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "worker thread #%u is doing garbage collection", i ) ;
01255 #endif
01256 
01257     }
01258     
01259   } while( worker_index == NO_VALUE_CHOOSEN );  
01260    
01261   last = worker_index ;
01262 
01263   return worker_index;
01264   
01265 } /* select_worker_queue */
01266 
01276 int nfs_rpc_get_worker_index( int mount_protocol_flag )
01277 {
01278   int worker_index = -1 ;
01279 
01280 #ifndef _NO_MOUNT_LIST
01281   if( mount_protocol_flag == TRUE )
01282       worker_index = 0 ; /* worker #0 is dedicated to mount protocol */
01283   else
01284     worker_index = select_worker_queue(  ) ;
01285 #else
01286   /* choose a worker depending on its queue length */
01287   worker_index = select_worker_queue() ;
01288 #endif
01289 
01290   return worker_index ;
01291 } /* nfs_rpc_get_worker_index */
01292 
01293 
01306 void nfs_rpc_getreq( fd_set * readfds, nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_para )
01307 {
01308   enum xprt_stat stat;
01309   struct rpc_msg * pmsg;
01310   struct svc_req * preq;
01311   register SVCXPRT *xprt;
01312   register int bit;
01313   register long  mask, *maskp;
01314   register int sock;
01315   char * cred_area ;
01316 
01317   LRU_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
01318   LRU_status_t  status ;
01319   nfs_request_data_t * pnfsreq = NULL ;
01320   int worker_index ;
01321   int mount_flag = FALSE  ;
01322 
01323   /* portable access to fds_bits field */
01324   maskp = __FDS_BITS( readfds ) ;
01325       
01326   for (sock = 0; sock < FD_SETSIZE; sock += NFDBITS)
01327     {
01328       for (mask = *maskp++; bit = ffs(mask); mask ^= (1 << (bit - 1))) 
01329         {
01330           /* sock has input waiting */
01331           xprt = Xports[sock + bit - 1];
01332           if (xprt == NULL)
01333             {
01334               /* But do we control sock? */
01335               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "CRITICAL ERROR: Incoherency found in Xports array" ) ;
01336               continue;
01337             }
01338 
01339           /* A few thread manage only mount protocol, check for this */
01340           if(  ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp ==  sock + bit - 1  ) ||
01341                ( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp ==  sock + bit - 1  ) )     
01342                 mount_flag = TRUE ;
01343           else
01344                 mount_flag = FALSE ;
01345          
01346           /* Get a worker to do the job */
01347           if( ( worker_index = nfs_rpc_get_worker_index( mount_flag ) ) < 0 )
01348            {
01349              DisplayLog( "CRITICAL ERROR: Couldn't choose a worker ! Exiting..." ) ;
01350              exit( 1 ) ;
01351            }
01352 
01353 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01354 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
01355           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Use request from spool #%d, xprt->xp_sock=%d",
01356                            worker_index, xprt->xp_fd ) ;
01357 #else
01358           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Use request from spool #%d, xprt->xp_sock=%d",
01359                            worker_index, xprt->xp_sock ) ;
01360 #endif
01361 #endif
01362 
01363           /* Get a pnfsreq from the worker's pool */
01364           P( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01365 
01366 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01367           /* For debugging memory leaks */
01368           BuddySetDebugLabel( "nfs_request_data_t" ) ;
01369 #endif
01370 
01371           GET_PREALLOC_CONSTRUCT( pnfsreq,
01372                                   workers_data[worker_index].request_pool,
01373                                   nfs_param.worker_param.nb_pending_prealloc,
01374                                   nfs_request_data_t,
01375                                   next_alloc,
01376                                   constructor_nfs_request_data_t ) ;
01377 
01378 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01379           /* For debugging memory leaks */
01380           BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
01381 #endif
01382           V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01383 
01384           if( pnfsreq == NULL )
01385            {
01386              DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "CRITICAL ERROR: empty request pool for the chosen worker ! Exiting..." ) ;
01387              exit( 0 ) ;
01388            }
01389 
01390 
01391           /* Set up pointers */
01392           cred_area = pnfsreq->cred_area ;
01393           preq = &(pnfsreq->req) ;
01394           pmsg = &(pnfsreq->msg) ;
01395 
01396           pmsg->rm_call.cb_cred.oa_base = cred_area ;
01397           pmsg->rm_call.cb_verf.oa_base = &(cred_area[MAX_AUTH_BYTES]);
01398           preq->rq_clntcred = &(cred_area[2 * MAX_AUTH_BYTES]);
01399 
01400           
01401           /*
01402            * UDP RPCs are quite simple: everything comes to the same socket, so several SVCXPRT
01403            * can be defined, one per tbuf to handle the stuff
01404            * TCP RPCs are more complex:
01405            *   - a unique SVCXPRT exists that deals with initial tcp rendez vous. It does the accept
01406            *     with the client, but recv no message from the client. But SVC_RECV on it creates
01407            *     a new SVCXPRT dedicated to the client. This specific SVXPRT is bound on TCPSocket
01408            *
01409            * while receiving something on the Svc_fdset, I must know if this is a UDP request,
01410            * an initial TCP request or a TCP socket from an already connected client.
01411            * This is how to distinguish the cases:
01412            * UDP connections are bound to socket NFS_UDPSocket
01413            * TCP initial connections are bound to socket NFS_TCPSocket
01414            * all the other cases are requests from already connected TCP Clients
01415            */
01416 
01417           if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp == sock + bit - 1  )
01418             {
01419               /* This is a regular UDP connection */
01420 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01421               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A NFS UDP request" ) ;
01422 #endif
01423               pnfsreq->xprt = pnfsreq->nfs_udp_xprt ;
01424               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_UDP ;
01425 
01426               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
01427             }
01428           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp ==  sock + bit - 1  )
01429             {
01430 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01431               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A MOUNT UDP request" ) ;
01432 #endif
01433               pnfsreq->xprt = pnfsreq->mnt_udp_xprt ;
01434               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_UDP ;
01435               
01436               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
01437             } 
01438           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_tcp == sock + bit -1 )
01439             {
01440               /* 
01441                * This is an initial tcp connection 
01442                * There is no RPC message, this is only a TCP connect.
01443                * In this case, the SVC_RECV does only produces a new connected socket (it does
01444                * just a call to accept and FD_SET)
01445                * there is no need of worker thread processing to be done
01446                */
01447 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01448               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "An initial NFS TCP request from a new client" ) ;
01449 #endif
01450               pnfsreq->xprt = nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_nfs_tcp ;
01451               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
01452 
01453               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) );
01454             }
01455           else if( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_tcp == sock + bit -1 )
01456             {
01457 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01458               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "An initial MOUNT TCP request from a new client" ) ;
01459 #endif
01460               pnfsreq->xprt = nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.xprt_mnt_tcp ;
01461               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
01462 
01463               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) );
01464             }
01465           else
01466             {
01467               /* This is a regular tcp request on an established connection, should be handle by a dedicated thread */
01468 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01469               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "A NFS TCP request from an already connected client" ) ;
01470 #endif
01471               pnfsreq->tcp_xprt = xprt ;
01472               pnfsreq->xprt = pnfsreq->tcp_xprt  ;
01473               pnfsreq->ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP ;
01474 
01475               pnfsreq->status = SVC_RECV( pnfsreq->xprt, &(pnfsreq->msg) ) ;
01476             }
01477 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01478           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Status for SVC_RECV on socket %d is %d", sock + bit -1, pnfsreq->status ) ;
01479 #endif
01480          
01481           /* If status is ok, the request will be processed by the related
01482            * worker, otherwise, it should be released by being tagged as invalid*/
01483           if( !pnfsreq->status  )
01484             {
01485               /* RPC over TCP specific: RPC/UDP's xprt know only one state: XPRT_IDLE, because UDP is mostly
01486                * a stateless protocol. With RPC/TCP, they can be XPRT_DIED especially when the client closes
01487                * the peer's socket. We have to cope with this aspect in the next lines */
01488              
01489               stat = SVC_STAT( pnfsreq->xprt ) ;
01490               if( stat == XPRT_DIED )
01491                 {
01492 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
01493                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "A client disappeared... socket=%d", pnfsreq->xprt->xp_fd ) ;
01494                   if( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_fd ] != NULL )
01495                     SVC_DESTROY( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_fd ] ) ;
01496 #else
01497                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "A client disappeared... socket=%d", pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ) ;  
01498                   if( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ] != NULL ) 
01499                     SVC_DESTROY( Xports[ pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ] ) ;
01500 #endif
01501 
01502                   P( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01503                   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pnfsreq,  workers_data[worker_index].request_pool, next_alloc ) ; 
01504                   V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01505 
01506                 }
01507              else if(  stat == XPRT_MOREREQS )
01508                {
01509                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Client on socket %d has status XPRT_MOREREQS", 
01510 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
01511                                   pnfsreq->xprt->xp_fd ) ;
01512 #else
01513                                   pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ) ;
01514 #endif
01515                }
01516  
01517               /* Release the entry */
01518 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01519               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Invalidating entry with xprt_stat=%d", stat ) ;
01520 #endif         
01521               workers_data[worker_index].passcounter += 1 ;
01522             }
01523           else
01524             {
01525               /* This should be used for UDP requests only, TCP request have dedicted management threads */
01526 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH           
01527               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Awaking thread #%d",worker_index ) ;
01528 #endif
01529 
01530               P( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01531               P( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01532 
01533               if( ( pentry = LRU_new_entry( workers_data[worker_index].pending_request, &status ) ) == NULL )
01534                {
01535                  V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01536                  V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01537                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "Error while inserting pending request to Thread #%d... exiting", worker_index ) ;
01538                  exit( 1 ) ;
01539                }
01540               pentry->buffdata.pdata = (caddr_t)pnfsreq ;
01541               pentry->buffdata.len = sizeof( *pnfsreq ) ;
01542 
01543               if( pthread_cond_signal( &(workers_data[worker_index].req_condvar) ) == -1 )
01544                 {
01545                   V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01546                   V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01547                   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCH: Cond signal failed for thr#%d , errno = %d", worker_index, errno ) ;
01548                   exit( 1 ) ;
01549                 }
01550                V( workers_data[worker_index].mutex_req_condvar ) ;
01551                V( workers_data[worker_index].request_pool_mutex ) ;
01552             }
01553         }
01554     }
01555 } /* nfs_rpc_getreq */
01556 
01569 int clean_pending_request( LRU_entry_t * pentry, void * addparam )
01570 {
01571   nfs_request_data_t ** preqnfspool = (nfs_request_data_t **)addparam ;
01572   nfs_request_data_t *  preqnfs     = (nfs_request_data_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata) ;
01573 
01574   /* Send the entry back to the pool */
01575   RELEASE_PREALLOC( preqnfs, *preqnfspool, next_alloc ) ;
01576 
01577   return 0 ;
01578 } /* clean_pending_request */
01579 
01592 int print_pending_request( LRU_data_t data, char *str )
01593 {
01594   return snprintf( str, LRU_DISPLAY_STRLEN, "not implemented for now" ) ;
01595 } /* print_pending_request */
01596 
01608 void rpc_dispatcher_svc_run( nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_param )
01609 {
01610   fd_set readfdset;
01611   static int tablesize ;
01612   int rc = 0 ;
01613   
01614 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS   
01615   static int nb_iter_memleaks = 0 ;
01616 #endif
01617   
01618   tablesize = getdtablesize();
01619 
01620   while( TRUE )
01621     {
01622       /* Always work on a copy of Svc_fdset */
01623       readfdset = Svc_fdset;
01624 
01625       /* Select on a fdset build with all socket used in NFS/RPC */
01626 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01627       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Waiting for incoming RPC requests" ) ;
01628 #endif
01629       
01630       /* Do the select on the RPC fdset */
01631       rc = select( tablesize, &readfdset, NULL, NULL, NULL) ;
01632 
01633 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01634       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "Waiting for incoming RPC requests, after select rc=%d", rc ) ;
01635 #endif
01636       switch( rc ) 
01637         {
01638         case -1:
01639           if( errno == EBADF )
01640             {
01641               DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SELECT, errno ) ;
01642               return;
01643             }
01644           break ;
01645          
01646         case 0:
01647           continue; 
01648 
01649         default:
01650 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01651           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS SVC RUN: request(s) received" ) ;
01652 #endif
01653           nfs_rpc_getreq(&readfdset, pnfs_param );
01654           break ;
01655          
01656         } /* switch */
01657         
01658         
01659 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01660     if( nb_iter_memleaks > 1000 )
01661       {
01662         nb_iter_memleaks = 0  ;
01663         nfs_debug_buddy_info() ;
01664       }
01665     else
01666       nb_iter_memleaks += 1 ;
01667 #endif
01668 
01669     } /* while */
01670 
01671   return ;
01672 } /* rpc_dispatcher_svc_run */
01673 
01685 void * rpc_dispatcher_thread( void * Arg )
01686 {
01687   int               rc         = 0 ;
01688   nfs_parameter_t * pnfs_param = (nfs_parameter_t *)Arg ;
01689 
01690   SetNameFunction( "dispatch_thr" ) ;
01691   
01692 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
01693   /* Initialisation of the Buddy Malloc */ 
01694   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Initialization of memory manager" ) ;
01695   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( &nfs_param.buddy_param_worker )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
01696     {
01697       /* Failed init */
01698       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Memory manager could not be initialized, exiting..." ) ;
01699       exit( 1 ) ;
01700     }
01701 #endif
01702   /* Calling dispatcher main loop */
01703   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: Entering nfs/rpc dispatcher" ) ;
01704 
01705   DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: my pthread id is %p", (caddr_t)pthread_self() ) ;
01706 
01707   rpc_dispatcher_svc_run( pnfs_param ) ;
01708   
01709   return NULL ;
01710 } /* rpc_dispatcher_thread */
01711 
01712 
01726 int nfs_Init_request_data(  nfs_request_data_t * pdata ) 
01727 {
01728   pdata->ipproto = 0 ;
01729   
01730   /* Init the SVCXPRT for the tcp socket */
01731   /* The choice of the fd to be used here doesn't really matter, this fd will be overwrittem later 
01732    * when processing the request */
01733   pdata->tcp_xprt = NULL ;
01734  
01735 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01736   if( (pdata->nfs_udp_xprt = Svc_dg_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
01737                                             NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
01738 #else 
01739   if( ( pdata->nfs_udp_xprt = Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_nfs_udp,
01740                                                 NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE) ) == NULL )
01741 #endif
01742     {
01743       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 );
01744       return -1 ;
01745     }
01746 
01747 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
01748   if( (pdata->mnt_udp_xprt = Svc_dg_create( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
01749                                             NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE ) ) == NULL )
01750 #else
01751   if( ( pdata->mnt_udp_xprt = Svcudp_bufcreate( nfs_param.worker_param.nfs_svc_data.socket_mnt_udp,
01752                                                 NFS_SEND_BUFFER_SIZE, NFS_RECV_BUFFER_SIZE) ) == NULL )
01753 #endif
01754     {
01755       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_RPC, ERR_SVCUDP_CREATE, 0 );
01756       return -1 ;
01757     }
01758 
01759   pdata->xprt = NULL ;
01760   
01761   return 0 ;
01762 } /* nfs_Init_request_data */ 
01763 
01764 
01777 void constructor_nfs_request_data_t( void * ptr ) 
01778 {
01779   if( nfs_Init_request_data( ptr ) != 0 )
01780      {
01781         DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: Error while initing request data " ) ;
01782         exit( 1 ) ;
01783      }
01784 }
01785 
01798 int nfs_Init_gc_counter( void )
01799 {
01800   pthread_mutexattr_t mutexattr ;
01801 
01802   if( pthread_mutexattr_init( &mutexattr ) != 0 )
01803     return -1 ;
01804 
01805   if( pthread_mutex_init( &lock_nb_current_gc_workers, &mutexattr ) !=0 )
01806     return -1 ;
01807 
01808   nb_current_gc_workers = 0 ;
01809   
01810   return 0 ; /* Success */
01811 } /* nfs_Init_gc_counter */
